title: (x) Zoogami beer ad - Alpin Gothic {Stephen}
content:
I need help with this one. Thanks in advanced!

[http://typophile.com/files/zoo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059/http:/typophile.com/files/zoo.gif "http://typophile.com/files/zoo.gif")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [zoo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059/http:/typophile.com/files/zoo.gif) | 50.65 KB |
author: monarchgg

comments.content: Very close to Trade Gothic Bold, and in the same ballpark as Alternate Gothic and News Gothic, but in all cases the spur on the G is different.
Wouldn't that be Akzidenz-Grotesk BQ condensed?
Akzidenz Grotesk is also close, but I still think the spur on the G is different. AG's M is different, too.

It also close from this font

[PT-Din-Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/pt-din-condensed/)

- - -

alainch

It is Alphin Gothic...

My only concern was the apostrophe on the word HERE'S. It throws me off...  
Here is a close-up from the original and the generate sample from:  
Original:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059im_/http:/typophile.com/files/alpin-original_5587.gif)

Copy:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative\_alliance/alpin\_gothic\_no\_...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/alpin_gothic_no_3/&sample_text=ZOOGATHEORY&sample_size=60 "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative\_alliance/alpin\_gothic\_no\_3/&sample\_text=ZOOGATHEORY&sample\_size=60")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059im_/http:/typophile.com/files/alpin-copy_4911.gif)

You guys think the apostrophe is from another font style?

Seems to [match](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012181059/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/alpin_gothic_no_3/&sample_text=HERE%E2%80%99S&sample_size=60) to me. Make sure you're looking at the true apostrophe and not a straight prime mark.
